column4: I have sun-java5-plugin and the current JRE  but still can't get java working in FF 2.0
am i missing something?
can you see java in about:plugins
let me check
nope, i can't see java , only Flash
your FF is the one that came with ubuntu or a one you've installed on your own?
should i unstall it?
no, but you should link the plugin to where you've installed it
libjavaplugin.so is linked to /etc/alternatives/firefox-javaplugin.so
its ok, "ls -l /etc/alternatives/firefox-javaplugin.so" to make sure its not a dead link, but I don't think it will be
yes its there
so its in my plugin dir. but firefox isn't accepting it apparently
its becasue FF2 is a custom install its probably looking for the plugins elsewhere, where did you install it?
most howtos I've seen have you install FF2 somehere under /opt etc.
yes its under opt
/opt
something like /opt/firefox ? so you should probably add a link to /opt/firefox/plugins ...
i owe you a beer
i was working out of /usr/lib/mozilla/plugins
and where in the world should you be, may I decide to collect?
i'll be in Vegas next week for PubCon
other than that Columbus, OH
cheers
